title: Visiting USA twice in a year?
question: This is regarding my parents who are holding multiple entry 10 years visa. They came to usa on December 2009 and returned on Feb 2010. They visited my brother place in CT And PA but didnt get a chance to visit me in CA. Can my father come to visit me now in September which is his visit to usa second time in a year? I have found that visitor cannot come twice in a year is that applicable to my father visit?
question_tags: Immigration,US visas,Immigrants and bank accounts,Bankruptcy,Debt,Debt relief,Bankruptcy and debt
answers: There is no law or rule preventing a person with a multiple entry visa from entering multiple times. That is pretty much teh reason for the visa. When he comes he should just bring with him proof of his previous entry and timely exit from the US and proof of ties to the home country (like his mortgage, bank statements, etc) just in case they give him a hard time at the border.

I have not heard of no such law. It does not really work this way. If the visit is a genuine with no intent to defraud the USCIS or with no intent of residing permanently, I doubt they will be denied entry.

Good Luck
